duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist Ophthalmologist with patient care and maintain patient flow.
Take patient history and perform high-level diagnostic testing to initiate the examination.
Demonstrate clinical knowledge and skill in assigned area and within scope of practice.
Administer medications safely and accurately per guidelines.
Prepare patients for eye examination and assist with office surgeries and routine exams.
Respond to urgent and emergent situations in a calm and capable manner.
Ensure readiness of reports and information to maximize patient visit.
Maintain appropriate supply levels and participate in site inspections and inventories.
Complete Quality Assurance assignments and ensure overall department compliance with requirements.
Demonstrate knowledge of equipment and Information Systems applications.
Document patient care events in a thorough and accurate manner.
Manage and complete AEHR tasks per prescribed time lines.
Support and knowledge of new applications and policies such as AEHR, Abbreviations, etc.
Demonstrate typing skills proficiency and knowledge of insurance, utilization review, and scheduling requirements.

education_certification.credential: 2 years of experience in Ophthalmology at an Assistant level.
AHA Basic Life Support for Healthcare Professional (AHA BLS Healthcare) - American Heart Association -REQUIRED
Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) - Joint Commission on Allied Health Professional in Ophthalmology (JCAHPO) -PREFERRED
Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) certification due within 12 months from hire date.
